intro: Schizocalyx neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia schizocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with dark green, leathery leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Schizocalyx neocaledonica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and restricted distribution.
